title: What is the American math education system? - Quora
tags: Education in the United States of America

response.answer_text: Pre-algebra->algebra 1->geometry->algebra 2->pre-calculus->calc 1 Pre-algebra is exactly what it sounds like, a lot of people actually skip it Algebra 1 is polynomials and whatnot Geometry is an in depth study of basic shapes, such as circles, squares, parallelograms, cubes, etc. Along with finding volume, area, etc. Algebra 2 is algebra + basic trigonometry Pre-calc is is more in depth trigonometry, identities, inverse trig, polar coordinates, and basic induction Calc 1 is differential calculus Some high schools go up to calc 2, but its not mandatory, and in most schools you can take statistics or some kind of applied math course instead of calc 1

“What is the American math education system?” Guess. Nonono, I don’t mean you, I mean that as an explicit answer to your question. The system is “Guess, and hope to get it right.” Better known by its political name, “Common Core”.
